title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5317.19 - Tax-reporting threshold
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5317.19 - Tax-reporting threshold

State Regulations

Every single-win or hand-pay message received by the MCS
that is in excess of a limit that is required by Federal or State tax reporting
shall advise the user of the need for a W2-G or 1042-S form to be processed, either via the MCS or manually. This option shall not be capable of being
overridden. The keyed reset ability to return winnings from a taxable event to
a gaming device should require user intervention to void the original jackpot
slip that is generated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5317.19

Adopted

New

York State Register November 16, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 46, eff. 11/16/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
